item.description:
I will be throwing on a pot or two of coffee and hosting some daytime Open Studios twice a week: Mondays and Thursdays between 10:30am and 2:30pm. 

Unfortunately I have to leave no later than 2:30pm in order to get to the bus for my daughter. If this time works for you then please join me to finish up any projects you're making, work on your ATCs for swaps, knitting, painting or on anything else you want.

This is a kid-friendly Open Studio (for those of you who would otherwise be unable to attend) but I have to stress that you will be responsible for keeping your child(ren) occupied at the studio. I will have some coloring pages on hand, and in the future I may have a more thought out craft available (for a small fee) if it seems that there is a need for that. 

In case of snow or icy conditions I may need to cancel so check your email before you leave for Holliston.

DAY/TIME: Thursday, January 19th, from 10:30am to 2:30pm

AGENDA: No scheduled activities. Work on your own projects at your own pace. The only thing we ask is that you keep your RSVP up to date so we know who's coming.

AMENITIES: Free parking. Table space and a chair. Access to some tools (paper cutter, heat gun, etc.) and some supplies including acrylic paints, old magazines and books for collaging. Access to a fridge, microwave, toaster oven, kitchen sink and restroom. 

COST: $10 to help defray the Studio rental costs. (ArtStudio 360 renters attend free.)

WHO MAY ATTEND: Any member of the NE ATC+ or Altered Art/Assemblage Meetups and their guests (kids welcome to attend with their parents - bring activities for them. I will have some coloring pages available.)

HOW TO SIGN UP: Reserve a place by RSVP-ing "yes" using Meetup's RSVP function. Space is limited, so please RSVP for your guests as well.

If your plans (or your guests' plans) change, PLEASE update your RSVP accordingly. Please do this right up to the start time of the event.

WHAT TO BRING: Your own materials and projects to work on (just as you do for the regular Meetup). But basic supplies -- scissors, glue, tape, blank ATCS, etc. -- are available for your use. Even if you show up empty-handed, we can get you started on projects.

CANCELLATIONS: In the unlikely event that we need to cancel---or even if we're just getting a late start--we'll post a message on the Web site and e-mail everyone who's RSVP'd "yes." So to be on the safe side, please check the Web site and your inbox before departing for ArtStudio 360!
item.how_to_find_us: Use front door (facing street) to enter building; come up 1 flight of stairs and we are first door on your right.

group.name: New England Artist Trading Cards Plus (ATCs+) Meetup Group

item.name: Open Studio (kids welcome), Thursday, 01/19, beginning at 10:30am in Holliston
